snippet.textDisplay: I find it amusing all the people whining that this isn't as good as the original. As someone who was around when the game came out and played the ever loving shit out of it, I can appreciate this remix and enjoy it. The addition of real instruments to the otherwise familiarity of the song is a nice thing. Beautiful even.
snippet.textOriginal: I find it amusing all the people whining that this isn't as good as the original. As someone who was around when the game came out and played the ever loving shit out of it, I can appreciate this remix and enjoy it. The addition of real instruments to the otherwise familiarity of the song is a nice thing. Beautiful even.

snippet.textDisplay: I always loved this song, and they kept the essence of the original song! I was sad when they remixed it in MKDD, but I admit that that version grew on me. Still, this one is the one I grew up with, which makes this nostalgia overload, lol, and will be my most favorite RR sound track ever. I want this game now, damn it!

snippet.textDisplay:
Truthfully, I prefer the original version of the song, despite not really playing Mario Kart 64 before. But I'm psyched for this game and being able to race at this course would be amazing! 

Edit: Ah, I see it now. I prefer Flute/Piano over Trumpet/Guitar. That's why I like the original better.

snippet.textDisplay: This theme is so monumental, and they remixed it very well! When you arrive at this stage in the original its like a great fanfare to all the greatness that is mario kart 64 and the path that has taken you there. with all the characters shown around the map its like a big tribute to the entire mario kart series, despite being only the seconde game at the time!

snippet.textDisplay: @MasterZhaituki Yeah, they really did change quite a bit, and I wish they kept it 3 laps, or at least made it 2 laps like Wario Colosseum, but still, the track is really pretty and they did a good job modernizing it. I see this more of an evolution of the N64 Rainbow Road, rather than a true retro track, like the other ones they've done. Maybe they'll remake it again in a future MK and have both the evolution and an updated version of N64 RR, like if they made two sets of tracks, a classic set like MKDD and before, and futuristic tracks like MK8 and after. They probably won't have the memory capacity to do that for a couple generations, but that would make for a really interesting lineup of tracks in, say, MK11.
snippet.textOriginal: @MasterZhaituki Yeah, they really did change quite a bit, and I wish they kept it 3 laps, or at least made it 2 laps like Wario Colosseum, but still, the track is really pretty and they did a good job modernizing it. I see this more of an evolution of the N64 Rainbow Road, rather than a true retro track, like the other ones they've done. Maybe they'll remake it again in a future MK and have both the evolution and an updated version of N64 RR, like if they made two sets of tracks, a classic set like MKDD and before, and futuristic tracks like MK8 and after. They probably won't have the memory capacity to do that for a couple generations, but that would make for a really interesting lineup of tracks in, say, MK11.

snippet.textDisplay: The Wii U bundle with this game should be enough for me to buy the console, though I do wonder if I should wait a bit and see what Nintendo does at E3. It's not like I don't already have tons of games in my backlog! I briefly listened to this game's soundtrack and find it alright, but not outstanding (though the live instruments are top notch). It'll probably have to grow on me. Some of the remixes like this one are quite awesome, sticking close to the original while adding just enough new elements and, of course, the much better sound quality.
snippet.textOriginal: The Wii U bundle with this game should be enough for me to buy the console, though I do wonder if I should wait a bit and see what Nintendo does at E3. It's not like I don't already have tons of games in my backlog! I briefly listened to this game's soundtrack and find it alright, but not outstanding (though the live instruments are top notch). It'll probably have to grow on me. Some of the remixes like this one are quite awesome, sticking close to the original while adding just enough new elements and, of course, the much better sound quality.
